column5: gpbrown: Did you get my e-mail?
Here's the outfitter on the cabonga where you can get maps from http://www.deer-horn-lodge.com
official Canadian Government web site with topo maps:http://toporama.ctis.nrcan.gc.ca/

That was an interesting thread on the Gouin Res and the information about the maps. Our group has been going to Cabonga for years and I would love to find a good map. Does anyone know if one's available. Thanks, gb

That was an interesting thread on the Gouin Res and the information about the maps. Our group has been going to Cabonga for years and I would love to find a good map. Does anyone know if one's available. Thanks, gb

GPBrown: Go to the World of Maps web page http://www.worldofmaps.com/ and select on-line store. Then do a search for cabonga reservoir. I followed these steps and ascertained that there is a 1:50,000 laminated map available for $24.95 Cdn.

GPBrown: Go to the World of Maps web page http://www.worldofmaps.com/ and select on-line store. Then do a search for cabonga reservoir. I followed these steps and ascertained that there is a 1:50,000 laminated map available for $24.95 Cdn.

To the best of my knowledge there aren't any hydrographic charts for any of the lakes within Quebec Parks. There are of course topo maps and they are readily available in a number of scales. Retire 55's link is a great source.

There is another link where you can get maps:http://www.jlcgeo.com/home/home.php

You are right McQ there is no hydrographic map for the Cabonga.
